column4: I am trying to run unetbootin. But it asks for password. Even if I enter correct passsword it says incorrect password.
I also tried "gksu unetbootin". Same thing.
I also updated the PPA to the one specifed in the website. And installed the new version. Same thing.
Any suggestions? I need to copy a bootable iso to a usb. Are there any other tools which does similar function?
dozens of tools at the pendrivelinux site. also it depends on which iso/disrto you are using.. ubuntu 11.10+ can use dd to put the iso image on a usb
the androud-x86 homepage may have guides on what tools to use. or try the pendrivelinux site.
usb-creator i think is for ubuntu iso's only
or just trry dd'ing the iso to a pendrive as a test.
that url gives directions  using a tool from pendrivelinux
It links to windows executable "Universal USB Installer". but I need to do in linux so I can copy the iso to *ext3* only usb drive
the pendrivelinux site has directions and tools for linux as well..
because the usb is an 'iso' filesystem. its also the exact size of the iso. (55mb i think)
So isn't there a way to copy that iso to usb as other tools should do like unetbootin?
i just did it with a tool from pendrivelinux. but i need to tweak the syslinux config file. it did a common error.
im not even sure how useable android on an i86 is at this time. It may be easier to just test it in virtualbox
No I tried ICS 3.0.1 on a usb of fat32, its higly usable, multitouch, sound, wifi works. I have x86 tablet so it is very  handy.
Meanwhile I am trying "live-usb-install" from pendrivelinux
Thanks for the help, good night.
